pullRequest.body:
Splitting it out in https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/21554 was motivated by avoiding imports of ENNReal.
This motivation has become moot now:
- with https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/22562, just the basic properties of ENNReal do not add that many
  further imports
- after https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/21670, Normed/Group/Basic.lean will import ENNReal anyway.

Adding to this, the split into Basic and Continuity was never really clear
in terms of imports: Basic.lean should be split further, but this does not seem
like a good splitting boundary.

While at it, replace one 'open' that has been likely mis-ported by 'open scoped'.

---

Basic thoughts: if the import increase is coming anyway, then I don't object to it happening in a preparatory PR. However, I don't know enough about the topology library to say for sure whether this is the best we can do currently. I'm not going to block nor approve this.
The import increase is much greater than I thought it would be after your split, so I'm happy to not merge this PR

FWIW, this import increase is much greater than in #21670: I don't think merging this PR is a good idea as-is. (And even if so, it might make more sense to re-evaluate after #21670.)

This is a bit of an import increase: the question is whether this is desirable or not.
